channel.title: Posts on Malay Dhamelia
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Malay Dhamelia

item.title: Hello Tuftesque
item.description: This is an abridged version of the blogpost Introducing The Tuftesque Blogdown Theme on livefreeordichotomize.com. Customizing It would be pretty lame if that was it, wouldn’t it? Fear not, you can tinker with it to make it your own. Side Notes: We all know why you’re here: the sidenotes. This is rather easy. Just make sure you have the tufte package installed and then, in an inline r chunk, wherever you want to put a side note call the following.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: Hugo-Tufte Features
item.description:
This is a quick demonstration post. It serves as an example of the features of this theme. One of them is \( \LaTeX \) via MathJax.

A Bit About Mathematics

item.title: Hide Date
item.description: Here is an example post where the date set, but hidden from display. Moreover, the reading time is also hidden.
